image.altText: A plane takes off with bright cylinders of flame streaking from its exhasts.

props.synopsis: The US military says the US has carried out retaliatory air strikes in Iraq and Syria against more than 85 targets linked to Iran's Revolutionary Guard and the militias they back.

title.children: 'If you harm an American, we will respond': US begins retaliatory strikes in Iraq and Syria

image.altText: cloud over mountain

props.synopsis: Take a climb up a peak in the early hours of the morning and you might be able to see a huge wave of white fog streaming down a cliff face. What causes these "cloud waterfalls" and how do you catch them?

title.children: Perfect conditions trigger rare 'cloud waterfall' in WA

image.altText: A digitally altered image featuring, from left to right, Boris Becker, Harley Reid and Tiger Woods.

props.synopsis: With local media in a frenzy over the West Coast Eagles top draft pick Harley Reid, Greig Johnston examines whether constant scrutiny of an 18-year-old yet to play a game is fair.

title.children: Should an 18-year-old kid who hasn't played an AFL game be subject to this level of exposure?

image.altText: Crime scene tape outside a home.

props.synopsis: South Australia Police says a mother and son have been found dead at a home at Rosewater in Adelaide's north-west. A 43-year-old man who lived in the same street has been arrested.

title.children: Man arrested following 'suspicious' deaths of mother and son in Adelaide's north-west

image.altText: A woman with a trolley stands in a stocked supermarket aisle.

props.synopsis: Since taking office last year, Roger Cook has changed the government's approach to youth justice, but he'll need to show he can also help ease cost-of-living pressures if he's to convince voters, writes Keane Bourke.

title.children: ‘No silver bullet’: WA Premier admits few options available to relieve cost-of-living pressure

image.altText: Anonymised pic of a doctor's hands at a desk holding a stethoscope

props.synopsis: Hannah achieved her dream of becoming a doctor — but she says it's come at a great cost due to the traumatic discrimination she's faced.

title.children: This GP says she faced an uphill battle to break into medicine because of her disability — and wants the stigma to end

image.altText: Floral tributes for a deceased man.

props.synopsis: The young man who drowned during an alleged robbery last month is mourned by hundreds at a vigil in Hobart — with a special thank you to those who tried in vain to save him.

title.children: 'Shattered our hearts': Young drowning victim remembered at Hobart vigil

image.altText: Sailor Ralph Bender with his boat in Koombana Bay

props.synopsis: The last place Ralph Bender expected to wind up was southern Western Australia missing part of his hand.

title.children: After days adrift and partially amputating his own finger, this Swiss sailor is recuperating in WA

image.altText: Luay Sako leaves a prison van, dressed in grey clothing.

props.synopsis: More than three years on, the family of Celeste Manno remain in disbelief that she was murdered by an intruder wielding a knife and a hammer in the middle of the night.

title.children: In a Melbourne court, the horror of 'bogeyman' killer Luay Sako's crime was laid bare

image.altText: Two men and a woman in suits stand behind podiums in front of a doorway into Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Regardless of whether Australia's economic picture is improving or heading for a crash, it's unlikely voters will have stage 3 tax cuts front of mind come the next general election, writes Melissa Clarke.

title.children: Australia's changing economy could undermine Albanese's big gamble

image.altText: Composite of heatwave map and workers from Queensland Fire and Emergency Services

props.synopsis: A burst of hot northerly winds will bring the highest temperatures in years to parts of south-east Australia, while ex-Tropical Cyclone Kirrily carves a trail of torrential rain and flooding.

title.children: Parts of South Australia, Victoria, NSW to experience hottest weather in up to three years

image.altText: A flooded street with a pub in the foreground

props.synopsis: If the tropical low develops into a cyclone, it would be Queensland's third in as many months.

title.children: Tropical low in Coral Sea could turn into cyclone as Kirrily hovers over Queensland's north-west

image.altText: Two-storey white house.

props.synopsis: If you're buying a home that has been "substantially renovated" you may have to pay GST. The problem home buyers face is that what qualifies as a "substantial renovation" is uncertain, writes Christine Peacock.

title.children: Buying a renovated home? You could be up for an extra 10 per cent GST, but it's a grey area

image.altText: A very dry expanse of land dotted by hative shrubs and bushes

props.synopsis: Amid the worst drought on record in the Gascoyne, the impacts of extreme heat is being felt by people and wildlife alike, with emus digging up town pipelines and putting holes in them for a drink.

title.children: Drought-affected Gascoyne cooks in double heatwave as animals seeking water dig up pipelines

image.altText: A group of people standing on the private charter boat "Waltzing Matilda"

props.synopsis: An environmental advocate says the changing climate means its more important than ever to protect the reef from human damage. It comes after a private charter skipper is convicted of numerous maritime offences.

title.children: Fears for health of Great Barrier Reef as skipper fined $15K over 21st birthday boat crash

image.altText: A man leaning on a truck with a high explosives sign on the front

props.synopsis: John Morgan's time spent hauling high explosives over rough roads were among the many audacious deliveries he made working for a company that opened up a remote corner of the country.

title.children: Dirt roads and dynamite: How an aviation pioneer's sacking inspired an outback trucking legacy

image.altText: A woman sits in a chair outside with a glass of champagne in her hands

props.synopsis: Catherina van der Linden died on Australia Day at Southern Cross Care's West Beach Residential Care home surrounded by her family. Her body will be donated to the University of Adelaide's Body Donation Program.

title.children: South Australian woman, believed to be Australia's oldest person, dies aged 111

image.altText: White capped waves roll towards the white sand that's surrounded by greenery under a deep blue sky.

props.synopsis: Crashing waves, beautiful boulders, emus and wombats help Squeaky Beach take out top spot on Australia's Top 10 best beaches.

title.children: 'It could be a painting': Victorian beach named the best in Australia

image.altText: Cr Brian O'Garey

props.synopsis: When a safe was found hidden in the walls of a local council office in south-east Victoria some years ago, a safecracker was hired in the hope of uncovering the long-lost treasure.

title.children: Whereabouts of golden mayoral chain worth $50K still a mystery after 20 years

image.altText: A young woman in surf life saving uniform on the a sunny beach while holding a club board

props.synopsis: By letting volunteers choose their rostered hours, a NSW surf life saving club has almost quadrupled its patrolling members, setting an example other clubs are now following.

title.children: Struggling to mount beach patrols, surf club's simple idea brings volunteers flooding back

image.altText: An 18-year-old female sprinter crosses the line in first place, with a smile, wearing a top and sprinting shorts.

props.synopsis: Fresh from setting the Australian record, 19-year-old Torrie Lewis is hopeful she can run even faster as she chases a qualifying time for the Paris Olympics.

title.children: Sprint star Lewis riding wave of confidence after breaking national 100m record

image.altText: Carl Weathers

props.synopsis: Carl Weathers, who played Apollo Creed in the Rocky movies and starred alongside Arnold Schwarzenegger in Predator, has died aged 76.

title.children: 'True legend' Carl Weathers, who played Apollo Creed in Rocky, dies aged 76

image.altText: Man in glasses surrounded by people waves to camera

props.synopsis: In a royal pardon granted on no grounds by an outgoing king, the former prime minister guilty of laundering state funds will be released by 2028 and subjected to a reduced fine of 50 million ringgit ($16 million) — a massive cut from the initial amount of 210 million ringgit ($68 million).

title.children: Malaysia halves jail term and drops $50m fine for corrupt ex-PM Najib Razak over 1MDB fund scandal

image.altText: African American man speaking to three college students about voting.

props.synopsis: The race for the Democratic presidential nomination begins this weekend in South Carolina but Joe Biden's chances of securing a second term in the White House aren't so certain, as young voters turn away.

title.children: Angry and disillusioned: The young voters who could cost Joe Biden a second term

image.altText: dean carelse SA team

props.synopsis: A basic internet search that would have revealed the criminal convictions of paedophile Dean Carelse was never done when he was screened for a job as a children's lifeguard at a UK family fun park, the ABC has confirmed.

title.children: A Google search would have revealed paedophile's past offences before he got lifeguard job – but nobody did one

image.altText: The front of a march where a banner reads 'honour the treaty'

props.synopsis: This weekend, 80,000 people are expected to arrive at the grounds where New Zealand's founding document was signed by Māori chiefs and representatives of the crown. And they have a message for the prime minister.

title.children: 'How dare they think that they can erase Māori': Why this long walk to Waitangi is so significant

image.altText: Illustration of three people, a woman and two men

props.synopsis: Australian scientists have made countless groundbreaking discoveries. The Science Show's Robyn Williams has selected a 'Top 100' and he wants to know what you think.

title.children: Can you name some of Australia's most pre-eminent scientists? Here are a few worth knowing about

image.altText: of one of the "inhabited bridges" in Bhutan's proposed mindfulness city featuring a robot and a traditional artisan.

props.synopsis: Bhutan's king has announced ambitious plans to develop a "mindfulness city" in a bid to boost the country's economy and reverse an exodus of young and qualified people seeking opportunities abroad — mainly in Australia.

title.children: Can Bhutan's plans for a 'mindfulness city' convince its diaspora community to come home?
